title: Scala Sans look-alike
content:
Hi all, I am new to posting, but have used this board  
as a reference for some time now. I’m hoping you can help this newbie!

I am looking for an opentype font which is similar to Scala Sans. It must have bold versions, small caps, and old style figures. I realize that Scala has an opentype version, but the cost is prohibitive!

I am using this for a publication that uses Scala, but in the next issue, I have to set many, many uncommon fractions.

I’m looking at  
 [Beret](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409024933/http:/www.linotype.com/91948/beret-family.html)  
but would love other suggestions.

Thank you for any help!

 [‹ Classy 1920's Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409024933/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31848 "Go to previous forum topic") [Visual distrotions in typeface, help needed ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409024933/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31784 "Go to next forum topic")
author: cardinal

comments.content: I am afraid, that similar fonts in this size and quality always costs a little bit more.

well, I am sure I could convince the non-profit that I work for to  
budget about $200 for a font, but I am going to have a hard t  
time convincing them to pay $400 for a font we already have!  
(albeit useless to me for this project)
[FF Scala Sans OT](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409024933/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FF.11571.0.0) Reg, Italic, Bold, Bold Italic = $196

Oh der. Now I feel like a goof. I checked that quickly and assumed SC/OS wasn’t supported. I checked the pdf and see that they are!

I found the $405 estimate from ITC [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409024933/http:/www.itcfonts.com/fonts/font/pid/427882/FF+Scala+Sans+Pro+Volume/detail&grab_id=0&page_id=72095&query=ITC%20Goudy%20Sans%20Pro&SCOPE=ITCFonts)

Thank you for your help!
